ygData.subject: large error in adiabatic flame temperature in equilibrium and flame calculations
ygData.msgSnippet: When one computes the the free-flame structure (say H2+air at PTN), the equilibrium temperature obtained is different from the true adiabatic flame temperature

Subject: large error in adiabatic flame temperature in equilibrium and flame calculations

When one computes the the free-flame structure (say H2+air at PTN),
the equ=
ilibrium temperature obtained is different from the true
adiabatic flame te=
mperature obtained via a direct equilibrium
calculation, using the same the=
rmo data.  The differences are on the
order of 10K for the example given.  =
Likewise, the enthalpy in the
flame of the equilibrium products is NOT foun=
d equal to reactants
enthalpy, although theoretically, they should be equal=
.  This leads me
to suspect that the non-conservative flame calculations in=
troduces
order 1 errors in the species concentrations of the products,
cons=
istent with the results of the simulations!  Are these
*acceptable* errors?=
??
